p: Several early studies confirmed that when the temperature exceeds 110 Â°C, and based on the temperature value, the addition of the silica (SiO 2) particles (usually greater than 30% by weight of cement (BWOC)) into the cement could considerably enhance the cement resistance to the strength retrogression [ 7]. Interaction of the reactive SiO 2 particles with portlandite phase (Ca(OH) 2 or CH), which is one of the main products of the cement hydration process, usually lead to formation of another stable phase of calcium silicate hydrated (C-S-H) species like tobermorite, trucostite, and xonotlite which are able to enhance the cement matrix mechanical properties [ 20, 21, 22, 23, 24]. Anti-retrogression agents are materials rich in silica such as silica sand and silica flour, which are mostly added to the oil well cement (OWC).
